reviewText: I don't know why this show wasn't picked up for more than one season, even with different guys.  It was a very interesting show and must have appealed to women and men.  Certainly the subject matter does.
summary: Certainly a better show that most of what is on tv today
Title: Gigolos: Season 1

reviewText: I enjoy this series. The men are fascinating. I particularly recommend giving this DVD as a bachelorette gift as it's exciting and a wonderful conversation/action starter for couples.
Title: Gigolos: Season 1

reviewText: I love this show! The guys are funny, warm & SO hot and sexy! I enjoy the conversations they have with each other about their clients more than the actual sex scenes.  I agree with everyone else about how the clients are not really, they're actresses & it's all scripted.  But it's still fun to watch, especially Brace, my favorite.  I highly recommend this show.
Title: Gigolos: Season 1

reviewText: The series takes you through some ups and downs of the profession of male escourting with some genuine feelings from the guys along with some compromising and strange fetishes from the women who hire them. All men show off their bodies quite a bit with just as much female nudity. This would be considered nc - 17 in my opinion, not quite an x.
Title: Gigolos: Season 1

reviewText: In an effort to provide provocative late night programming to Showtime, sometimes actor Richard Grieco masterminded a project entitled "Gigolos." Charting the lives and adventures of five call boys in glamorous Las Vegas, this reality program strains for credibility. Don't get me wrong. I have nothing against the idea of a show documenting the profession of male escorts. In fact, I think it's a refreshing change of pace amidst the landscape of cable soft core adult entertainment to focus on a few guys for a change. However, nothing about this reality series seems the least bit real.The clients (often labeled with professions as diverse as elementary school teachers or nurse's aides) don't seem like likely candidates to have hundreds of dollars to spend on high end escorts. Some even improbably live in palatial estates or rent extravagant suites for the occasion! No downturned economy here. A remarkable number of these clients also seem to already have a professional film career (if you get my meaning) with their willingness to disrobe, show off their surgical enhancements, and have sex on television. You'd think that professional businesswoman and everyday housewives and mothers might be a bit more prudent about what they allowed to be broadcast on national television. But any doubts about the legitimacy of some of these adventures is squashed by the most obviously fake encounter of the season. One of the guys meets a client in her office (sparsely furnished with rental furniture) and has sex loudly with a secretary right outside the door. Of course, there is a convenient hidden camera in the outer office (how'd that get there?) to capture her reactions to the lovemaking noises. It's silly and harmless titillation, I suppose, it just isn't particularly real.What you're left with is the guys. Do you want to spend time with them? Of course this being forced reality, they hang out together as friends. A particularly painful episode had one (Steven) throw a temper tantrum because his friends didn't celebrate his birthday in the right way. Even though they tried, he stomped about like a petulant child. Sadly, he was probably the most relatable character until then as a struggling father separated from his child. We also have Jimmy, whom I actually liked well enough--a well rounded individual who made the move from stripping to escorting and is at peace with his choice. Then there is Nick who might be pretty enough to look at, but seems incapable of intelligent conversation. And Brace, an aging lothario, who is his own biggest fan. And enthusiastic Vin--a newcomer to the profession that doesn't get quite as much development (although he does get a ludicrous storyline where someone pays him a gigolo fee to attend dance classes).Of course, the show might generate a fair amount of interest just on subject matter. If the topic appeals to you, try to sample an episode or two. I can't imagine anyone would want to watch this more than once, so investing in the DVD isn't an easy recommendation for me to make. KGHarris, 8/11.
summary: Late Night Entertainment From Showtime--Taking The Real Out Of Reality Programming
Title: Gigolos: Season 1

reviewText: This may not be the best television out there but I found it fun.  The guys are attractive and the situations they are in entertaining.
